courseDetails.title: 8 Ways To Have A More Productive, Centered Life
courseDetails.shortDescription: Discover how to focus your energy where it matters most while enjoying more of a sense of peace
courseDetails.longDescription:
Is it possible to be both productive and centered at the same time? The answer is yes!

We often think of being productive as being able to get a lot of things done.

The problem is, that definition doesn’t really work very well for most of us. It implies that we must be busy, busy, busy when what we truly want is to be less busy.

When we think about being centered, we might envision someone who is calm in the face of life’s demands: someone who is able to take care of everything without becoming overly stressed.

If we’ve never experienced that type of calm while also being able to do what’s needed, we may wonder if it’s possible, or if we somehow have to be born that way.

It’s definitely possible to learn how to approach life, and all its demands, from a new perspective: one that encourages centeredness instead of that sense of being frantic.

In this course, you’ll learn:

  • How to recognize the crucial difference between overload and overwhelm

  • How to create a to-do list that you’ll actually love

  • How to start a meditation practice if that might help you feel calmer

Take a small step today toward being more productive and more centered, at the same time.

courseDetails.title: Optical Character Recognition (OCR) MasterClass in Python
courseDetails.shortDescription: Learn OCR in Python using OpenCV, Pytesseract, Pillow and Machine Learning
courseDetails.longDescription:
Welcome to Course "Optical Character Recognition (OCR) MasterClass in Python" 


Optical character recognition (OCR) technology is a business solution for automating data extraction from printed or written text from a scanned document or image file and then converting the text into a machine-readable form to be used for data processing like editing or searching.


BENEFITS OF OCR:


  • Reduce costs

  • Accelerate workflows

  • Automate document routing and content processing

  • Centralize and secure data (no fires, break-ins or documents lost in the back vaults)

  • Improve service by ensuring employees have the most up-to-date and accurate information


Some Key Learning Outcomes of this course are:


  • Recognition of text from images using OpenCV and Pytesseract.

  • Learn to work with Image data and manipulate it using Pillow Library in Python.

  • Build Projects like License Plate Detection, Extracting Dates and other important information from images using the concepts discussed in this course.

  • Learn how Machine Learning can be useful in certain OCR problems.

  • This course covers basic fundamentals of Machine Learning required for getting accurate OCR results.

  • Build Machine Learning models with text recognition accuracy of above 90%.

  • You will learn about different image preprocessing techniques such as grayscaling, binarization, erosion, dilation etc... which will help to improve the image quality for better OCR results.

Assessment Description:


Product management and development are critical functions within any organization. They involve the creation, launch, and ongoing improvement of products and services to meet customer needs and drive revenue growth. As such, assessing an employee's proficiency in these areas is essential for companies to ensure that their product strategy is on track and aligned with their business goals.


A product management and development assessment can help companies identify skill gaps and areas of improvement for their employees, leading to better performance and increased productivity. By measuring an employee's understanding of market trends, customer needs, product development, and product launch strategies, companies can better equip their workforce to deliver products that meet customer demands and stay ahead of competitors.


For employees, a product management and development assessment is an opportunity to showcase their skills and knowledge in this critical area. It allows them to demonstrate their understanding of product strategy, market analysis, and development processes, which can lead to career advancement opportunities within their organization. As they gain experience in product management and development, employees can hone their skills and become valuable contributors to their company's success.


In addition to career advancement, product management and development topics are also useful for building a successful career. These skills are transferable across industries and can be leveraged to drive innovation, create new products, and launch successful startups. For individuals who are passionate about creating products that solve customer needs, a career in product management and development can be highly rewarding and fulfilling.


Overall, a product management and development assessment is a critical tool for companies and employees alike. It allows companies to evaluate their workforce's proficiency in this area, identify areas of improvement, and build a culture of product innovation. For employees, it is an opportunity to showcase their skills, advance their careers, and build a successful future in product management and development. By investing in product management and development assessment, companies can stay ahead of the competition and drive growth and innovation in the market.

courseDetails.title: Self Learning Computer Science: Beginner to Advanced
courseDetails.shortDescription: Computer Science, Networking, Operating Systems, Software Development, Distributed Systems, Learning
courseDetails.longDescription:
Are you tired of feeling overwhelmed by the constant changes in the software industry and the pressure to keep up with the latest trends?

Are you frustrated with your field's lack of diverse and relevant knowledge?

This course provides you with a lifelong learning roadmap and references to build a solid foundation for your career in the software industry.

In this course, we will cover a wide range of topics, including engineering topics such as algorithms and data structures, compiler design, computer architecture, programming languages, databases, distributed systems, file systems, mathematics, networking, operating systems, and general programming and design patterns, as well as non-engineering topics such as advertising and marketing, business management, economics, finance, and behavioral economics, people management, including introspection, psychology, evolution, history, and philosophy.

Use prompt engineering with search engines to narrow the universe to the fundamentals you need!

For each topic, we will answer the following questions:

  • Why should you learn this topic?

  • When is the best time to understand this topic?

  • What should you know about the topic?

  • How should you decide what to learn about the topic?

  • Who should you learn it from?

  • Where should you apply the knowledge?

  • When should you use the knowledge?

We will also discuss the importance of treating people as individuals with unique needs and personalities rather than "resources" with predictable behavior. Finally, we will explore the human element of software engineering and the importance of understanding the broader perspective and fundamentals of dealing with teams.

The course will help you avoid the industry's common pitfalls and build a fulfilling and successful career in software.


Why is learning the right things at the right time from a career development perspective necessary?

Learning the right skills and knowledge at the right time can significantly impact your career growth and success. It allows you to stay current with industry advancements, meet the demands of your job, and remain competitive in the job market. Investing in your professional development at the right time can build a strong foundation for a successful and fulfilling career.

How can learning the right things at the right time help you advance your career?

By learning the right skills and knowledge at the right time, you demonstrate your commitment to professional growth and development. Being proactive can lead to opportunities for advancement, such as promotions, leadership roles, and higher salaries. Additionally, staying current with industry advancements can increase your value to your current employer, making you a valuable asset to the organization.

What are some ways to determine what to learn and when?

To determine what to learn and when, it's essential to assess your current skills and knowledge, consider your career goals, and stay informed about industry trends and advancements. Additionally, seeking advice from mentors and industry experts and regularly reviewing job descriptions for positions you aspire to can help determine what skills and knowledge to acquire.

Will this roadmap help me become a staff engineer later in my career?

Yes!

From a knowledge perspective, the software engineering role of staff engineer pertains to diversity of knowledge. The diversity aspect comes from experience. To gain the background, one should be aware and informed enough to identify the opportunity. The experience is tested in system design interviews as well. Faking experience is a waste of time and unethical.

Unlock Your Potential in the Software Industry with Self-Learning - Discover the Power of Continuous Improvement in Your Career. Gain the Skills and Knowledge to Stay Ahead of the Competition and Advance Your Career in Software Development. Get started today and invest in your future success!

courseDetails.title: SQL Boot Camp 2023: Complete SQL Course
courseDetails.shortDescription: Using PostgreSQL & applicable to Oracle SQL, Microsoft SQL Server, and MySQL for Data Science, Apps and Web development.
courseDetails.longDescription:
Ready to take your data querying skills to the next level? Look no further than this comprehensive PostgreSQL course!


Using real-world examples from the Airlines Database, this course covers everything you need to know about PostgreSQL, including:


- Installing and creating tables in PostgreSQL

- Understanding SELECT statements, WHERE clauses, and operators

- Advanced techniques like GROUP BY, HAVING, and Aggregation Queries

- Handling time and date data in SQL

- Table joins, sub-queries, and window functions for analytics

- SQL challenges and a final exam for extra practice


But why learn SQL in the first place? SQL was originally created to enable non-IT professionals to query data from datasets without needing to ask a programmer for help. By learning SQL, you'll develop new mental models for thinking about data, which is a powerful skill in today's data-driven world.


Plus, PostgreSQL is free, open, and unlimited, making it the perfect tool to learn about relational databases. Its advanced implementation of SQL is very close to the SQL standard, making your knowledge transferable to other SQL databases.


And perhaps the most compelling reason to learn SQL? It can do wonders for your career. Having PostgreSQL knowledge on your resume and online profile can make you a highly attractive candidate to recruiters, opening up new career opportunities and possibilities for advancement.


So what are you waiting for? Enroll in this course today and become a PostgreSQL querying expert!
targetAudiences: Are you want to learn more about SQL & PostgreSQL ?
Are you ready for upcoming SQL interview questions?
Are you want to use SQL in Data Analysis, Apps Development or Web Development?

courseDetails.title: Creating Online Course with AI
courseDetails.shortDescription: Elevating Your Online Course Business: Creating Contents with AI and Implement Effective Marketing Strategies
courseDetails.longDescription:
Welcome to Creating Online Course with AI. This is a comprehensive guide for starting your first E-learning and info product business. This course will be concentrating on two main aspects, the first will be focusing on creating content for your online course where you will be guided step by step on how to automatically generate contents for your online course using AI tools, meanwhile, the other one will be focusing on the business perspective where you will learn how to market your online course and know how to set the right price for your online course. In the introduction session, you will learn the basic fundamentals of the E-learning business model, such as getting to know the market overview of the E-learning industry, getting to know all the benefits of selling online courses and also getting to know where you can sell your online course. Then, you will continue by learning how to conduct extensive market research and learn how to identify target students. In this section, you will learn how to find high demand topics in the market using tools like Udemy marketplace insight and Validator AI. Before starting to create content for your course, you will learn how to use AI tools like Bard and Flow GPT to generate compelling titles, outline, and descriptions for your online course. Then, you will enter the project section where you will be guided step by step on how to generate high quality contents for your online course using eight AI tools, those are Course Box AI, Courseau, Tutor AI, Mind Smith AI, Course Factory AI, Mini Course Generator, UnSchooler, and Learning Studio AI. Those AI tools are completely free and relatively easy to use, the only thing that you need to do is to type in the topic and in less than five minutes AI will be able to generate the content for your online course. Once you have completed the project section, the course will be continued by a case study comparing pros and cons of creating mini courses with short duration vs creating comprehensive courses with long duration. Then, you will also get to know some of the best options for screen recording softwares, background noise removal, and video editing software. Afterward, you will also learn several strategies to set the right price for your online course, specifically you will learn about value propositions and testing multiple pricing points. Lastly, at the end of the course, you will learn several effective marketing strategies to promote your online course and reach more potential students. In this section, you will learn about social media promotion, running ads, and building referral programs.

First of all, before getting into the course, we need to ask ourselves this question, why should we sell online courses? Well, there are a lot of answers to that question. Firstly, an online course or info product is considered to be a digital product which basically means that you only need to create the product once and it can potentially be sold many times as long as you know how to promote your online course, therefore, it can be considered as a passive income. Not only that, the E-learning industry also has a bright future and massive potential as the market size of this industry was valued at $399.3 B and it is projected to grow at 14% CAGR. Last but not least, if you like teaching and sharing your knowledge to other people, this might be one of the best business models that you should consider as it allows you to generate income while doing things that you are passionate about.

Below are things that you can expect to learn from this course:

  • Learn the basic fundamentals of E-learning business, such as getting to know the market overview of E-learning industry and all benefits from selling online course or info product

  • Learn how to conduct market research and identify target students for online course

  • Learn how to generate title, outline, and description for online course with Bard and FlowGPT

  • Learn how to generate online course content with Course Box AI

  • Learn how to generate online course content with Courseau

  • Learn how to generate online course content with Mini Course Generator

  • Learn how to generate online course content with Mind Smith AI

  • Learn how to generate online course content with Learning Studio AI

  • Learn how to generate online course content with Course Tutor AI

  • Learn how to generate online course content with Course Course Factory

  • Learn how to generate online course content with Course Unschool

  • Case study: selling mini course vs selling comprehensive course

  • Learn how to record screen using Snip Clip and Quicktime Player

  • Learn how to remove background noise using Weet

  • Learn several pricing strategies for online course, such as value proposition and testing multiple different pricing points

  • Learn how to promote online course using social media promotion, running ads, and building referral program
targetAudiences: People who are interested in starting E-learning business
People who are interested in creating online course content and info product using AI
People who are interested in online course marketing
